definition: "Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
dust/dirt/earth
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
dust/dirt/angstrom/phonetic ai or e
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: But the world has become a repeated dust, the dust has settled that moment, Jesus Christ reincarnation.
sentences.chinese: 不过成为世间一屡尘埃，尘埃落定那刻，万世轮回。

sentences.english: It takes the edge off my hangover, kicks up the dust of last night’s drunk and gives it life.
sentences.chinese: 宿醉勾了起来，昨晚已经尘埃落定的醉意又焕发生机。

sentences.english: After a long time negotiations, the restructuring between GAIG and Changfeng Automobile is finally settled.
sentences.chinese: 旷日持久的广汽与长丰汽车重组一事终于尘埃落定。

sentences.english: Your period of meditation, reflection, or investigation will soon begin to wind down.
sentences.chinese: 你现阶段的考量，沉思或者是调查会开始尘埃落定。

sentences.english: He has promised that one day he will set everything right.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺我们，有一天，一切会尘埃落定。

sentences.english: The state of completion always creates a sense of achievement.
sentences.chinese: 尘埃落定总是会造就成就感。

sentences.english: Recently, the Legend interested in the real estate sector apprehensively finally settled.
sentences.chinese: 近日，有关联想有意介入地产界的悬念终于尘埃落定。

sentences.english: A rainfall will settle the dust on the road.
sentences.chinese: 一场雨使马路上的尘埃落定。

sentences.english: The court had made the final sentence of Xuting case, but reflecting upon this case just begin.
sentences.chinese: 许霆案已经尘埃落定，但对于该案的反思才刚刚开始。

sentences.english: Definite End is the Tibetan minority writer Alai's first novel.
sentences.chinese: 《尘埃落定》是藏族作家阿来的第一部长篇小说。

definition: to come to the end of a phase (idiom)
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
the curtain drops/the end of the show
foregone conclusion/to be settled conclusively
that clinches it/that's final/no two ways about it
pending a decision/hanging in the balance
to announce publicly/to publish/to make known/to disclose
to float up (idiom); to become evident/to surface/to appear
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
coda/epilogue/end
up until now/so far
bright/clear/obvious/forthright/open-minded/bright and cheerful
heavy curtain
near at hand/imminent/within sight
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
the whole truth is revealed (idiom); everything becomes clear
